meanings.definition: To seek the affection or love of someone, typically with the intention of marriage.
meanings.sent1: He was wooing her with flowers and chocolates.
meanings.sent2: John is wooing Mary by taking her out on romantic dates.
meanings.sent3: The cat was wooing the dog with a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The sun was wooing the earth with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The knight was wooing the princess with his chivalrous deeds.

meanings.definition: The act of trying to gain the love or favor of someone.
meanings.sent1: Her wooing of the prince was successful.
meanings.sent2: The wooing of the audience by the singer was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The wooing of the cat by the mouse was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The wooing of the clouds by the wind created a beautiful sky.
meanings.sent5: The wooing of the customer by the salesman was skillful.

meanings.definition: The act of trying to persuade or entice someone.
meanings.sent1: His wooing of the investors was convincing.
meanings.sent2: The wooing of the students by the teacher was engaging.
meanings.sent3: The wooing of the bird by the squirrel was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The wooing of the keys by the locksmith was skillful.
meanings.sent5: The wooing of the audience by the magician was captivating.
